oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Daniel B. Replogle loyalty oath to the United States and pass
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Oath of loyalty to the United States for Daniel B. Replogle. Describes eye color, height, etc and is signed by the Office of Provost Marshal. The Loyalty Oath was a document signed by persons during and after the Civil War to pledge loyalty and allegiance to the Union. Initially intended for employees of the Federal government and military personnel, the oath soon took several different forms and eventually extended to the state level. The pass allowed bearer to pass between Union lines.
